revised_title: Thomas Young's Observations on Vision and the Accommodation of the Eye
tldr: The author, Thomas Young, discusses various theories on how the eye accommodates to view objects at different distances. He examines the structure of the crystalline lens and proposes that its muscles change its shape to focus light on the retina. This discovery helps explain how the eye focuses on objects at different distances.
